: Yoga Reimagined: Developing and
Validating a VR Experience
Studienprojekt Quality & Usability (9LP) (Interdisziplinäres Medienprojekt (10LP) also possible)

This project will focus on creating a Virtual Reality (VR) Yoga application,
aiming to bring together the latest in technology with the traditional
practice of yoga. Working together with the Information and
Communication Management (ICM) team, our primary task will be
usability testing. This is to make sure that the app is easy to use,
enjoyable, and helpful for people who want to practice yoga, regardless
of their experience level.

During the development stage, we will design a virtual space that feels
peaceful and suitable for yoga. The app will be user-friendly and offer a
variety of yoga exercises and guided meditations that users can do with
just a VR headset.

The usability testing will be a crucial part of our project. We plan to
carefully check how the VR Yoga app works from different angles, such
as how easy it is to navigate, how engaging the content is, and how
satisfied users feel with their overall experience. We will use feedback
from these tests to make the app better, aiming for it to be both useful
and enjoyable.

Our goal for this project is to create a VR Yoga app that leads the way in
digital wellness, offering users a new and immersive way to support
their physical, mental, and emotional health in our digital age.
- Basic knowledge of 3D modeling, coding in Unity
